metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000205 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
U-Boot contains a CWE-20: Improper Input Validation vulnerability inVerified boot signature validation that can result in Bypass verified boot.This attack appear to be exploitable via Specially crafted FIT image andspecial device memory functionality.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

u-boot - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-amlogic - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-exynos - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-imx - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-mvebu - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-omap - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-qcom - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-rockchip - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-rpi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-sunxi - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-tegra - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
u-boot-tools - 2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: u-boot package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2019.07+dfsg-1ubuntu6').
